{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3322429,"name":"Quinton Rodgers","username":"Quint0n53","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/b782af/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T05:40:52.009Z","cooked":"

We have been having an issue where every time we power cycle our robot “deletes” its code. After a power cycle, the driver station says that there is no Robot Code and after we deploy code, it works as usual. Periodically, we are also having the code crash while driving. Our assumption is that these problems are related to each other and with large amounts of memory storage. We are not able to pin point an issue. Unfortunately I have no pictures or code to share. Any advice or previous posts would be helpful.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T05:40:52.009Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":81,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":436.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457021,"topic_slug":"roborio-booting-without-code","display_username":"Quinton Rodgers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57681,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7757 Alumni/4476 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-booting-without-code/457021/1","custom_user_title":"7757 Alumni/4476 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3322538,"name":null,"username":"shush","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/aeb1de/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T14:36:37.417Z","cooked":"

For the first issue (power cycle delets code),
Go to the RoboRIO’s web dashboard or the imaging tool, and verify that the “Disable RT Startup App” checkbox is unchecked.

For the second issue (code crashes), you’ll have to provide more information. What is the stack trace? What happens before the code crashes? Can you share your code?

As a follow up, we went into the Rio today and confirmed that the Disable RT was unchecked, but the issue persists.

Any other ideas?

It happened to us a few weeks ago and we got stuck on it for several days. in our case turns out the robot code was loading but it was immediately crashing before the robot code light even turned green. turns out it was because we asked what the alliance color was before we were connected to the driver station. to solve this, every time we want to get the alliance color, we first check if the alliance is empty and only if it is not empty we check the color.

Java

Will take a look at Uri’s suggestion (it worked! Thank you!)

Will continue the search on why we crash (or will keep seeing if it does and report back )

Make sure you pay attention to the hints/warnings/errors that VSCode (or intellij) is giving you. There should definitely be a warning whenever you try to get the value of an Optional without first checking .isPresent()

Can you elaborate a little on this error? We are having a similar issue with no robot code, and we do no see any error or stack trace in the log. We check .isPresent() before calling .get() on the aliance color, so I think we’re doing the right thing there. That said, we might be missing something.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-03-04T17:21:03.315Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457021,"topic_slug":"roborio-booting-without-code","display_username":"DrewTheRat","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55701,"username":"uriGoldstein","name":"Uri Goldstein","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/urigoldstein/{size}/180332_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27359,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-booting-without-code/457021/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3324289,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T07:22:29.383Z","cooked":"

When ended up solving our problem is doing:
if (!DriverStation.getAlliance().isEmpty()) {
then asking for the Alliance color
}

You should use DriverStation.getAlliance().isEmpty() to check if there is alliance.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T07:24:29.821Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":26.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457021,"topic_slug":"roborio-booting-without-code","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":27359,"username":"DrewTheRat","name":"DrewTheRat","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drewtherat/{size}/8858_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-booting-without-code/457021/11","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3324290,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T07:23:45.183Z","cooked":"

For some reason (at least on our project) vs code doesn’t raise any errors and warnings.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T07:23:45.183Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":30.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457021,"topic_slug":"roborio-booting-without-code","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-booting-without-code/457021/12","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3324382,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T14:27:38.149Z","cooked":"

Generally you would call DriverStation.getAlliance() once and save that as a local variable of type Optional<Alliance>. Then your if condition is myAllianceColor.isPresent() rather than !isEmpty() like you did.

For the record, we found code calling DriverStation.getAlliance().get() without any isPresent() check. We’ll test tonight, but pretty sure this is the issue.
